sentences.text: Dear Fellow Marathon Petroleum Corporation Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of the Board of Directors and management team, I am pleased to invite you to attend Marathon Petroleum Corporations Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held in the Auditorium of Marathon Petroleum Corporation, 539 South Main Street, Findlay, Ohio 45840 on Wednesday, April 26, 2017, at 10 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we at MPC continue to work with a near-term intensity to execute strategic actions to enhance shareholder value, we remain committed in the long term to operational excellence, generating compelling capital returns and delivering enduring value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Marathon Petroleum Corporation delivered strong operational and financial performance for our shareholders in 2016, a year that marked our fifth year as a stand-alone company and our first year incorporating the MarkWest business in our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also announced plans for strategic actions to enhance shareholder value
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MPC has a track record of success and continues to deliver strong returns for our investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With strengthening commodity prices, recovering refinery spreads and our aggressive plans to enhance investor value, we remain well positioned across the business to create and deliver long-term value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MPC drew upon its strengths in 2016 in order to deliver solid results despite a challenging year from a commodity price and margin perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the years notable achievements were record financial results from our stable-cash-flow Speedway and Midstream segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have included a Proxy Summary at the beginning of our Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Proxy Summary is intended to provide highlights of the Proxy Statement, including facts regarding our corporate governance and our 2016 company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hope you find the Proxy Summary beneficial.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Looking forward, we are enthusiastic about our plans to enhance shareholder value and remain encouraged by the opportunities ahead, particularly the growth opportunities at MPLX, in our Midstream segment, which will continue to be a source of long-term value for our investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We thank you for investing in MPC, for sharing in our vision and for contributing to our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since our formation in 2011, we have generated more than $13 billion in net income and increased our base dividend at a 28 percent compound annual growth rate through 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also returned more than $10 billion to shareholders.

sentences.text: GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MPLX LP (or MPLX) is a diversified, growth-oriented master limited partnership (or MLP) formed in 2012 by Marathon Petroleum Corporation to own, operate, develop and acquire midstream energy infrastructure assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MPLX is engaged in the gathering, processing and transportation of natural gas; the gathering, transportation, fractionation, storage and marketing of NGLs; and the transportation and storage of crude oil and refined petroleum products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We own an approximate 28 percent interest in MPLX, including the general partner interest, and we consolidate this entity for financial reporting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: References to MPLX are included in these materials as appropriate to add clarity to certain disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The separation of Marathon Petroleum Corporation from Marathon Oil Corporation (which we refer to as Marathon Oil) was completed on June 30, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: References to the separation of Marathon Petroleum Corporation from Marathon Oil (which we refer to as the Spinoff) are included in these materials as appropriate to provide an explanation of certain disclosures relating to prior periods or compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On December 4, 2015, MarkWest Energy Partners, L.P. (or MarkWest), which owns and operates midstream service businesses, merged with and became a wholly owned subsidiary of MPLX (which we refer to as the MPLX/MarkWest Merger).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration of this proposal, the Board has determined that retention of the limited supermajority voting requirements in MPCs Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation (or the Certificate) and its Amended and Restated Bylaws (or the Bylaws and, collectively with the Certificate, the Governance Documents) remains in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.

sentences.text: Without these provisions, it would be possible for a small group of very large shareholders to approve fundamental changes to corporate governance that are opposed by many more, smaller shareholders who comprise nearly half of the votes cast.

sentences.text: To Safeguard Long-Term Shareholder Interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is bound by fiduciary duties to act in a manner that it believes to be in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders, on the other hand, do not have the same fiduciary duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, a group of shareholders  who may be acting in their own short-term or other interests not shared by MPC investors generally  may vote in a manner that is detrimental to large numbers of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, our supermajority voting requirements safeguard the long-term interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To Ensure Broad Shareholder Consensus for Limited Fundamental Corporate Governance Matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Governance Documents, a simple majority vote requirement applies to most matters submitted for shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonetheless, our Board believes that supermajority voting requirements applicable to a limited number of actions under our Governance Documents are appropriate and necessary to protect against imprudent actions favored by less than a compelling number of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supermajority voting requirements remain an established tenet of Delaware corporate law and the Board believes that targeted requirements of this nature maximize long-term value for all shareholders on the belief that fundamental changes to corporate governance should have the support of a broad consensus of the Companys shareholders.

sentences.text: By demanding that a small number of corporate actions receive the support of a greater than simple majority of votes cast (which at any given shareholder meeting would be less than half of our outstanding shares as not all shares are voted), our governance structure ensures that fundamental changes may be made only with broad-based support.

sentences.text: Shareholder-Friendly Features of Our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program contains the following shareholder-friendly features that align with contemporary governance practices, promote alignment with our pay-for-performance philosophy and mitigate risk to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do:        cap annual cash bonus and performance unit payouts;        have long-term incentive (or LTI) awards based on relative total shareholder return;        impose an additional one-year holding requirement for all shares received under our incentive compensation plan;        have double triggers for change-in-control payout provisions for all LTI awards;        maintain significant stock ownership guidelines for NEOs and other executive officers;        impose clawback provisions on both long-term and short- term incentive awards;        conduct an annual shareholder say-on-pay vote on NEO compensation;        have limited business perquisites; and        retain an independent compensation consultant who regularly advises the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not:              allow the hedging or pledging of MPC stock;              enter into employment contracts with NEOs or any other executive officers;              guarantee minimum bonus payments to any of our executive officers;              provide tax gross-ups for perquisites;              pay dividends or dividend equivalents on unvested equity;              allow the repricing of stock options without shareholder approval;              provide excise tax gross-up provisions with regard to any change in control of MPC; or              grant stock options below fair market value as of the grant date.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation program plays a critical role in maximizing long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It supports our ability to attract, motivate, retain and reward the highest quality executives to excel within our performance culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use our executive compensation program to create value for our shareholders through the quality products and services we provide to our customers.

sentences.text: We do this while striving to maintain our sustainability and environmental commitments by acting responsibly toward those who work for us, those business partners who work with us and with every community in which we operate.

sentences.text: After evaluating our year-to-date financial, operational and employee performance, considering shareholder feedback and comparing the compensation of our NEOs and other executive officers to that of executives of companies within our peer groups, the Compensation Committee decided to continue our existing compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our existing philosophy generally targets the Total Direct Compensation (defined as base salary + target bonus + intended value of annual LTI awards) for our NEOs and other executive officers at the median (50th percentile) of the compensation for similar executives of companies in our peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In support of this philosophy, the decisions of the Compensation Committee are designed to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide fair and competitive levels of compensation, after taking into account individual roles and responsibilities, while allowing for the discretion to place each NEO and other executive officer within the competitive range of each pay element;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: align compensation programs with the performance of MPC and the individual;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: foster an ownership culture that aligns the interests of our NEOs and other executive officers with those of shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: address the cyclical commodity influences of the business; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensure compensation programs do not encourage NEOs and other executive officers to take excessive risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ACB program is a variable incentive program intended to motivate and reward NEOs and other executive officers for achieving short-term (annual) financial and operational business objectives that drive overall shareholder value while encouraging responsible risk-taking and accountability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves the establishment of a qualified Section 162(m) funding pool for the ACB program in the first quarter of each year to ensure payments from the program qualify as performance-based compensation if certain metric levels are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This maximizes our tax deductibility opportunity with respect to the compensation paid from the ACB program for NEOs and other executive officers whose Section 162(m) compensation may otherwise exceed $1 million.

sentences.text: The performance metrics used to determine the 2016 Section 162(m) funding pool were net income and mechanical availability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net income was chosen as it measures MPCs profitability.

sentences.text: Mechanical availability is an essential element in achieving our financial and operational objectives and a significant indicator of the success of our operations as it measures the availability and reliability of the processing equipment in our refinery and midstream operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The funding pool for 2016 was established by the Compensation Committee as the greater of 2 percent of net income or $19 million if mechanical availability reached 91 percent.

sentences.text: Based on net income attributable to MPC of $1.17 billion, after adjusting for certain items, our pool for 2016 executive bonuses was $23.9 million.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved the actual incentive payments for each of our NEOs at levels less than what the pool would have otherwise permitted.

sentences.text: As a result, all 2016 ACB payments made in 2017 were fully tax deductible.

sentences.text: MPC Performance Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes a performance unit program serves as a complement to stock options and restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our program benchmarks MPCs TSR relative to a peer group of oil industry competitors and a market index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This relative evaluation allows for the cyclicality of our business and commodity prices (crude oil) to be recognized and prevents volatility from directly advantaging or disadvantaging he payout of the award beyond that of our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee continues to believe that TSR relative to a peer group is the single best metric for our performance unit program as it is commonly used by shareholders to measure a companys performance relative to others within the same industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also aligns the compensation of our NEOs with the value delivered to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The design of our performance unit program ensures we pay above target compensation only when our TSR is above the median of the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our program, TSR for MPC and each of the peer group companies is measured over a 36-month performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each performance cycle has four measurement periods: (1) the first 12 months, (2) the second 12 months, (3) the third 12 months, and (4) the entire 36-month period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MPCs TSR performance percentile within the peer group is measured for each measurement period, with the related payout percentage determined using the following table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if MPCs TSR is negative for a measurement period, the payout percentage for that measurement period is capped at target (100 percent) regardless of actual relative TSR performance percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR Percentile        Payout (% of Target)*   100th (Highest)    200% 50th    100% 25th    50% Below 25th      0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Payout for TSR between quartiles will be determined using linear interpolation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each performance unit is dollar denominated with a target value of $1.00.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual payout will vary from $0.00 to $2.00 (0 percent to 200 percent of target).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final value of the award will be determined by multiplying the simple average of the payout percentages for the four measurement periods by the number of performance units granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards will then settle 25 percent in MPC full-value common stock and 75 percent in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR is determined by taking the sum of a companys stock price appreciation or reduction, plus its cumulative cash dividends, for each measurement period and dividing that total by the companys beginning stock price for that period, as illustrated below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (Ending Stock Price  Beginning Stock Price) + Cumulative Cash Dividends Beginning Stock Price
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The beginning and ending stock prices used for MPC and each peer group member in the TSR calculation will be the average of their respective closing stock prices for the 20 trading days immediately preceding the beginning and ending date of the applicable measurement period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that providing four measurement periods over a 36-month cycle is appropriate and serves the best interest of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By having four equally weighted measurement periods, attaining maximum payout is more difficult as maximum payout levels can only be achieved by outperforming the TSR peer group for all four measurement periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our design also mitigates significant market fluctuations in stock price at the beginning or end of a performance cycle and does not encourage high-risk decisions near the end of a performance cycle by limiting their impact on the overall payout of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee also believes that having the maximum payout capped at $2.00 per unit helps mitigate excessive or inappropriate risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the MPLX program, the TUR and that of each of the peer group members is measured over a 36-month performance cycle.

sentences.text: The MPLX Board also believes that providing four measurement periods over a 36-month performance cycle is appropriate and serves the best interests of its unitholders.

sentences.text: The Marathon Petroleum Excess Benefit Plan permits the Compensation Committee, on a discretionary basis, to extend a lump sum retirement benefit supplement (or Service Benefit) to individual officers of MPC to offset the age-related erosion of benefit from age 62 until such officers actual retirement date or date of death.

sentences.text: The Service Benefit will not correct for any age-related erosion of benefit occurring prior to an officer reaching age 62 but, for those officers selected by the Compensation Committee in its sole discretion, the Service Benefit will correct for the age-related erosion of benefit from age 62 until such officers actual retirement date or date of death.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
